Suggestions? Thanks! Matt

item.title: Ticket #994 (Installation files not internazionalized) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: That string cannot be translated because wp-config.php must be loaded before we can make gettext calls. Since the error occurs in the event that wp-config.php cannot be loaded, gettext is not available.

item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
e.g. ​http://www.semiologic.com/cats/information-technology/

The page should display 50 items, currently has 25 of them, yet it adds a 'next page'. Admin panel says I've 21 items in the category. But then there are subcategories so this is probably not relevant.

I reported this bug once, but it seems it disappeared from the list.

-- denis _\@/_ semiologic.com

item.title: Ticket #1033 (Missing gettext entries) updated
item.dc:creator: sakis
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1033 (Missing gettext entries) created
item.dc:creator: sakis
item.description:
1. In Manage - Files: the word 'Other Files'
  2. In Link Categories: the 'Y', 'N' and 'rand' values
  3. In plugins: 'Visit author homepage' title tooltip. (In both admin-functions.php and functions.php)
  4. In Dashboard's recent activity box: the word 'on' as is for example in "Administrator on hello world!"

Also under blog stats, title tooltips for article, commens and categories.

  1. The word 'Uncetegorized'

I hope it helps

item.title: Ticket #1032 (Cockneyreplace can't be customised) updated
item.dc:creator: slebog
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1032 (Cockneyreplace can't be customised) created
item.dc:creator: slebog
item.description: It would be useful to allow customisation of the cockneyreplace feature in functions-formatting.php. End-users could then add their own words more easily, and localisers could provide lists relevant to their language.

item.title: Ticket #1031 (Problem displaying output of a page when its slug is equal to the slug ...) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Oops, my bad: it's not both posts that are outputted but rather only one of the two is outputted for both. That's what I get for filing a bug too quickly, I guess.

Also, a clarification: when I said "'top' is undefined", I meant that the specific number and type of pages there was something I hadn't tested, so I don't know how the value of 'top' affects whether the error happens or not.

item.title: Ticket #1031 (Problem displaying output of a page when its slug is equal to the slug ...) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1031 (Problem displaying output of a page when its slug is equal to the slug ...) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: If you have two pages with the same slug (for example, /quux/foo/baz/ and /quux/bar/baz/), the contents of both pages are outputted when viewing either page.

item.title: Ticket #1027 (/archives/%year%/%month%/%post_id%/ permalink collision) updated
item.dc:creator: bdjohns1
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1027 (/archives/%year%/%month%/%post_id%/ permalink collision) created
item.dc:creator: bdjohns1
item.description:
See ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic.php?id=24337 for discussion.

Basic problem is that the above-referenced permalink style (which is valid, since it resolves to a single post) conflicts with year/month/day rewrite rules for those cases where the post_id is <100.

My workaround is to delete the year/month/day rules from .htaccess and modify the remaining rules to prevent it trying to resolve $day references.

item.title: Ticket #911 (Wrong default for post author from edit-form-advanced.php) updated
item.dc:creator: dwc
item.description:
anonymousbugger,

You can open edit-form-advanced.php and go to line 160, which should look like this:

if ( $post_author == $o->ID ) $selected = 'selected="selected"';

Change that line to look like this:

if ( $post_author == $o->ID or $user_ID == $o->ID ) $selected = 'selected="selected"';

item.title: Ticket #911 (Wrong default for post author from edit-form-advanced.php) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
for those of us that want to just edit the file and don't know where to exactly remove and replace the accompanying code, may we please have intructions for that - and/or specific instructions for applying a patch - since i don't know how to do it. thank you.

edited on: 03-04-05 17:02

item.title: Ticket #1026 (htaccess generation incomplete) updated
item.dc:creator: quidditch
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1026 (htaccess generation incomplete) created
item.dc:creator: quidditch
item.description:
I want to generate an .htaccess file using the following structure :

/%year%/%monthnum%/%day%/%post_id%/

Wordpress generate the content I attach as additional information. It works when I need short URL for years, months, and days, but when I want to acces the links to pages or single posts, it instead reloads the index page, even if the URL seems correct.
